thread.title: Mesut Ozil gives Arsenal hope he’ll sign new deal by insisting he loves living in London
thread.title_full: Mesut Ozil gives Arsenal hope he’ll sign new deal by insisting he loves living in London

author: gsweet
title: Mesut Ozil gives Arsenal hope he’ll sign new deal by insisting he loves living in London
text:
'I'm very happy' Mesut Ozil gives Arsenal hope he’ll sign new deal by insisting he loves living in London 
German midfield playmaker also insists he is 'very happy at Arsenal and that 'we will see, there will be talks' By Geoff Sweet 24th March 2017, 3:28 pm Updated: 24th March 2017, 3:35 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MESUT OZIL has given Arsenal fans hope that he might be staying by insisting: “I’m very happy at Arsenal and in London.” 
Ozil’s contract at the Emirates is due to expire at the end of next season and there has been a wealth of speculation that he might leave this summer were another club to offer him a mega pay deal. PA:Press Association 4 Mesut Ozil…loves living in London 
Arsenal – conscious that should the situation drag on until next year Ozil could walk away for free – have offered talks this summer. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But there remain fears that German playmaker Ozil, and top scorer Alexcis Sanchez, will go at the end of the season. 
Happily for the Gunners, said: “The fact is I’ve still got a contract in London. Most popular WARBURY V GILLS Warriors in action as Nick flies off to Florida - can they fire their way to victory? HART STOPPER Joe Hart to captain England vs Lithuania... but fears he could get Three Lions chop like Wayne Rooney Dier situation Eric Dier warns England fans they must behave against Lithuania after shameful actions in Germany sealing the deal Jose Mourinho pictured in Croatia as he bids to get £35million Ivan Perisic deal over the line brita 'n twisted Germany U21s 1 England U21s 0: Young Lions suffer same fate as Gareth Southgate's seniors but there's nothing unlucky about this one NORRIS MINOR Swindon's team is youngest in top 4 divisions and Luke Norris says lack of experience is costly 
“To speculate now would be wrong. At the end of the season we will see, there will be talks. I’m very happy at Arsenal and in London.”
